{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3641618,"name":"Korcan","username":"korcan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/977dab/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-31T04:59:33.616Z","cooked":"

For the next season, we are planning to switch to swerve drive modules. It will be our first time using swerve drives, and there are many different options available. We are wondering which module performs best overall — Mk4, Mk5, X2T, Thriftybot…

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-05-31T04:59:33.616Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":591,"readers_count":590,"score":213.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502623,"topic_slug":"best-swerve-drive-module-overall","display_username":"Korcan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67338,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/best-swerve-drive-module-overall/502623/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3641627,"name":"M","username":"Mako","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mako/{size}/265816_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-31T05:12:42.042Z","cooked":"

You’re not gonna get a straight answer about that from anyone because all are mostly the same, just differing price points, weight, features, and size of communities around each module.

Pick what you need, what you can buy, and when you want it by.

My team’s pick for next year is going to be TTB due to WCP being in constant Backorder with their FIM bundle and SDS not being price or weight competivive for us.

ngl MK5n looks pretty good

No team running MK5n has lost champs.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-05-31T06:04:26.587Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":21,"reads":557,"readers_count":556,"score":1161.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502623,"topic_slug":"best-swerve-drive-module-overall","display_username":"Totally out of touch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69147,"username":"Isaac-The-Pro","name":"Isaac Proctor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/isaac-the-pro/{size}/265401_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":63}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3609,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/best-swerve-drive-module-overall/502623/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":57},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":19},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"call_me_hand","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":82,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3641653,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-31T11:20:47.691Z","cooked":"

This is a religious question. You’re going to get a lot of answers as we have a lot of cooler solutions right now.

I would keep in mind the following options as they affect the total cost of ownership.

  • software. The CTRE software is just amazing and basically eliminates a headache. So picking a solution that has a simple means of generation code and configurations is a big deal. (I believe the thrifty bot solution also has a generator too)
  • support. If you are new to swerve what do the teams near you have? What do people at events tend to have? Having folks around to help you trouble shoot is useful. Also consider where the company is and how easy is it to get spare parts.
  • cost and compatibility of consumables. Does the drive eat through tires? Is it compatible with 3d printed tires? Do you have options like colsons?
  • cost of parts. Are parts like a wheel encoder extra? Can you use a smaller motor for the turning motor? Does it use standard 10-32 screws
  • reliability and track record - if you have to constantly repair/retune it will cost you time.

A lot of variables here to consider beyond just the sticker price.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-05-31T11:22:09.960Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":481,"readers_count":480,"score":316.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502623,"topic_slug":"best-swerve-drive-module-overall","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":13}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/best-swerve-drive-module-overall/502623/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":13,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3641658,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-31T12:13:29.439Z","cooked":"
Isaac-The-Pro:

MK5n looks pretty good

The fully sealed unit along with the smaller footprint made us order a set to replace our mk4i’s. Those modules have been bullet proof, so I trust sds to release a quality product right from the start. The sealed unit is huge, no worry about carpet fuzz in the bevel gear or needing to print a cover to keep things out of the rest of the gears. Quick gear ratio changes are a nice plus too

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-05-31T12:14:08.233Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":431,"readers_count":430,"score":176.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502623,"topic_slug":"best-swerve-drive-module-overall","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"My views are mine and mine alone"},"post_url":"/t/best-swerve-drive-module-overall/502623/6","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3641718,"name":"","username":"LPryor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lpryor/{size}/220287_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-31T14:59:39.490Z","cooked":"

Last thought. Make sure you buy an extra module or two and some spare parts. We like to have two modules ready to go for drop in replacement. And with some drives you’ll need a left and right drive. This should all be calculated into the TCO.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-05-31T17:43:59.225Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":402,"readers_count":401,"score":245.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502623,"topic_slug":"best-swerve-drive-module-overall","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 8280, President Motor City Alliance"},"post_url":"/t/best-swerve-drive-module-overall/502623/7","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3641752,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-31T16:11:44.470Z","cooked":"

Plummer Industries probably makes the best one overall. Its not cheap and the software isn’t the easiest either. You would have to use YAGSL or make your own thing. The maintenance and “oh crap this broke, BUT I CAN FIX IT BEFORE OUR NEXT MATCH!” on them is second to none and the price reflects that.

I really do like them and wish more teams used them (but ultimately $500 modules are expensive and impractical for most teams)

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-05-31T16:11:44.470Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":15,"reads":371,"readers_count":370,"score":244.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502623,"topic_slug":"best-swerve-drive-module-overall","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL Creator & Maintainer"},"post_url":"/t/best-swerve-drive-module-overall/502623/8","reactions":[{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":7},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":17,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3641800,"name":"Tim Winters","username":"ArchdukeTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-31T17:27:32.299Z","cooked":"
nstrike:

Plummer Industries probably makes the best one overall.

Is maintainability the only thing they do better? Their documentation is poor, CAD model is only available upon purchase which makes it hard to test integration, they’re made of 6061 which has caused issues in the past (and why SDS uses 7075), and there don’t seem to be extra mounting holes for cameras like other modules offer

BUT I CAN FIX IT BEFORE OUR NEXT MATCH

what about them makes them more serviceable than others?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-05-31T18:59:26.770Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":336,"readers_count":335,"score":252.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502623,"topic_slug":"best-swerve-drive-module-overall","display_username":"Tim Winters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":12}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19820,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"78 AIR Strike Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/best-swerve-drive-module-overall/502623/9","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":12,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3641827,"name":"Mete Karadeniz","username":"irresistiable","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/f19dbf/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-31T17:59:24.303Z","cooked":"

Most teams use mk4i for their swerve modules . I also recommend you to use mk4i. There is so much references for that module but i also heard about X2T is also so solid at speed. I would prefer mk4i to X2T for first year.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-05-31T17:59:24.303Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":316,"readers_count":315,"score":98.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502623,"topic_slug":"best-swerve-drive-module-overall","display_username":"Mete Karadeniz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68396,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/best-swerve-drive-module-overall/502623/10","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3641895,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-31T22:53:38.666Z","cooked":"
ArchdukeTim:

what about them makes them more serviceable than others?

For example the entire wheel comes off with 1 or 2 bolts. The gears are easy to take off and the entire module shouldn’t take too long to work either. I would defer to @Austin_Plummer; we had a pretty good chat about them at worlds and everything made sense afterwards. I will let them restate it here if they choose.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-05-31T22:53:38.666Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":261,"readers_count":260,"score":142.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502623,"topic_slug":"best-swerve-drive-module-overall","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL Creator & Maintainer"},"post_url":"/t/best-swerve-drive-module-overall/502623/11","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3641906,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-31T23:28:59.045Z","cooked":"

A 2.5" drive wheel is going to be a problem if there are any obstacles on the field. Just because we haven’t had a cable bump since 2023 doesn’t mean we won’t for future games. I know with the 4" wheel there is enough space to use a suspension tire on it, 3d printed. A 2.5" wheel doesn’t

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-05-31T23:28:59.045Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":232,"readers_count":231,"score":136.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502623,"topic_slug":"best-swerve-drive-module-overall","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51887,"username":"nstrike","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"My views are mine and mine alone"},"post_url":"/t/best-swerve-drive-module-overall/502623/12","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3641931,"name":"Austin Plummer","username":"Austin_Plummer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/austin_plummer/{size}/245236_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-01T00:30:13.334Z","cooked":"

There is a lot of documentation coming out soon with more explanation of features that I’ve been able to convey much better in person and at worlds. (I’m rather bad on the documentation side which is why we are focusing on that right now). I’d rather not hijack a thread to discuss all of them but there is now support for the 3D printed wheel type mentioned above and maintainability and modularity is one of the modules design goals. At the same time there is definitely disadvantages as well to our design decisions.

The good thing about all of the options on the market currently is that there are so many to choose from. Teams can decide what features work best for them and for what priorities they have as a team. There are many different design priorities teams have so there may not be an overall “best” swerve module for everyone.

Can’t speak on their swerve but I enjoyed talking to the folks from Plummer at Champs. And we swear by their bumper mounts. They are terrific. So there’s no doubt in my mind that they have a great product.

Also @nstrike is terrific - given his work on YAGSL, I would certainly heed his endorsement!

But as Austin said we have an incredible amount of competition and choice for drive systems - which is truly a beautiful thing.
